body.p: A single row in a template.XULElem("listbox"). The text of the listitem is specified either using template.XULElem("listcell") elements, or by placing a template.XULAttr("label") attribute directly on the listitem element. By default it contains a single listcell element of type and class appropriate to that of the listitem.
More information is available in the XUL tutorial.

dl.dd: template.PrefAnch("a-", "accesskey"), template.PrefAnch("a-", "checked"), template.PrefAnch("a-", "command"), template.PrefAnch("a-", "crop"), template.PrefAnch("a-", "current"), template.PrefAnch("a-", "disabled"), template.PrefAnch("a-", "image"), template.PrefAnch("a-", "label"), template.PrefAnch("a-", "preference"), template.PrefAnch("a-", "selected"), template.PrefAnch("a-", "tabindex"), template.PrefAnch("a-", "listitem.type", "type"), template.PrefAnch("a-", "value")

template.PrefAnch("p-", "accessKey"), template.PrefAnch("p-", "accessible"), template.PrefAnch("p-", "checked"), template.PrefAnch("p-", "control"), template.PrefAnch("p-", "crop"), template.PrefAnch("p-", "current"), template.PrefAnch("p-", "disabled"), template.PrefAnch("p-", "image"), template.PrefAnch("p-", "label"), template.PrefAnch("p-", "selected"), template.PrefAnch("p-", "tabIndex"), template.PrefAnch("p-", "value")

body.pre: <listbox id="theList"> <listitem label="Ruby"/> <listitem label="Emerald"/> <listitem label="Sapphire" selected="true"/> <listitem label="Diamond"/> </listbox>
body.p: The following classes may be used to style the element. These classes should be used instead of changing the style of the element directly since they will fit more naturally with the user's selected theme.

dl.dd: template.XULElem("listbox"), template.XULElem("listcell"), template.XULElem("listcol"), template.XULElem("listcols"), template.XULElem("listhead"), template.XULElem("listheader")
